title: Chelsea continue to flourish under Frank Lampard as Marcos Alonso's goal sinks stubborn Newcastle
text:
It was the manager’s name they sang after Newcastle United’s resistance had been broken and Chelsea are a club dancing to Frank Lampard’s tune once again.

Newcastle were stubborn and organised; a tough nut to crack, but Chelsea simply kept squeezing and eventually the visitors’ defence splintered as Marcos Alonso found the target.

It was enough for Chelsea to secure their fifth successive win and there is a buzz and an excitement around the place that owes so much to the man in the dugout.

As a player, Lampard won games with decisive goals. Things are different now, but this win still had his fingerprints on it as Chelsea came out in the second half a different side to the one that had been so easily frustrated at the end of the first.

As good as results have been of late, this was a reminder that Chelsea have their limitations as they struggled to get on top of a Newcastle side that was comfortable sitting deep and a menace with the speed of their counter-attacks.
description: It was the manager’s name they sang after Newcastle United’s resistance had been broken and Chelsea are a club dancing to Frank Lampard’s tune once again.
